title: Gawain
summary: Gawain (/ɡəˈweɪn/; Welsh: [ˈɡawain]), also known as Gawaine or Gauwaine, among other forms and spellings, is a character in Arthurian legend in which he is King Arthur's nephew and a Knight of the Round Table. The prototype of Gawain is mentioned under the name Gwalchmei in the earliest Welsh sources. He has subsequently appeared in many Welsh, Latin, French, English, Scottish, Dutch, German, Spanish, and Italian Arthurian stories, notably as the protagonist of the famous Middle English story Sir Gawain and the Green Knight. Other tales featuring Gawain as the central character include De Ortu Waluuanii, Diu Crône, The Awntyrs off Arthure, Ywain and Gawain, Golagros and Gawane, L'âtre périlleux, La Vengeance Raguidel, Le Chevalier à l'épée, The Greene Knight, and The Weddynge of Syr Gawen and Dame Ragnell.
